page.title: 12THE SEVERN FLOODS AND BORES
page.content: THE RIVER BRINGS ITS PROBLEMS The stretch of the River Severn which runs through the area is called Long Reach. Every winter the river overflows its banks and floods the valley. The floodwaters can reach Sandhurst, often covering the road to Gloucester south of the village. When this happens the villagers must go east through Walls- worth to find a dry route out. In the Sandhurst School log book it was recorded on 29th January 1960 that a teacher, Mrs Dudfield, had to be car- ried across deep flood water to get her to the school! From Maisemore Park the floods can stretch up to 2km to the southeast across the Vale of Gloucester towards the city. The Severn is world-famous for its Bore, a tidal wave which is highest in spring. This is visible at Sandhurst, but so far inland it is not very large.
